author: R Sivaraman
text:
Criminal action will be taken against those who violate the order

The banners that are not removed beyond the deadline will be cleared by the authorities and the cost collected from those who had put up the publicity materials.— file photo

The Department of Revenue and Disaster Management, Special Secretary and Puducherry District Collector S.Sundaravadivelu have ordered that all wall posters, digital banners, cut-outs, and hoardings in public places should be removed by Saturday.

A consultation meeting was held last year with representatives of political parties, police, and revenue and public works department officials, as per the directions of the Madras High Court, to implement the provisions of the Pondicherry Open Places (Prevention of Disfigurement) Act strictly.

Then District Collector D.Manikandan and all political parties unanimously agreed to ban all writings, paintings, cut-outs, digital banners and hoardings. Advertisements of government and government-run institutions are exempt from the rule.

Issuing yet another notification on Wednesday, Mr. Sundaravadivelu said in the whole of Union Territory of Puducherry it is strictly prohibited for any individual or organisation or political party or its supporters to write or paint on walls, paste wall posters and erect cut-outs and banners.

Such materials should be removed by the persons concerned by Saturday.

If they fail to adhere to the deadline, revenue authorities will remove them and collect the cost from the political parties or organisations concerned.

“Criminal action will be taken against those who break the order,” said Mr. Sundaravadivelu.
title: Parties told to remove posters, hoardings by tomorrow
